Class oracle.plsql.PDate

Class oracle.plsql.PDate 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.plsql.PValue
           |
           +----oracle.plsql.PDate
public class PDate
extends PValue
This class encapsulates PL/SQL dates. It is implemented to look like java.util.Date as closely as possible.

PDate()
Constructs a null PL/SQL date.
PDate(Date)
Constructs a new PL/SQL Date and initializes the value with the given Date.

clone()
Clone this PDate.
copy(PDate)
Copies the PDate.
dateValue()
Returns the value of this PDate as a Date.
getDate(Date)
Gets the value of this PDate.
setValue(Date)
Sets the value of this PDate.
toString()
Returns the String representation of this PDate.

PDate 
  public PDate()
Constructs a null PL/SQL date.
PDate 
  public PDate(Date value)
Constructs a new PL/SQL Date and initializes the value with the given Date.
Parameters:
value - the initial value of the PDate

dateValue 
  public Date dateValue()
Returns the value of this PDate as a Date. You should use isNull() to determine if this value is NULL before getting the Date value.
Throws: NullValueException
If the value is NULL.
See Also:
isNull
getDate 
  public void getDate(Date date)
Gets the value of this PDate. You should use isNull() to determine if this value is NULL before getting the Date value.
Parameters:
value - the Date value to set to
Throws: NullValueException
If the value is NULL.
See Also:
isNull
setValue 
  public void setValue(Date date)
Sets the value of this PDate. To set this PDate to null, use setNull().
Parameters:
value - the Date value to set to
See Also:
setNull
clone 
  public synchronized Object clone()
Clone this PDate.
Overrides:
clone in class PValue
copy 
  public void copy(PDate value)
Copies the PDate.
Parameters:
value - the PValue to copy from
toString 
  public String toString()
Returns the String representation of this PDate.
Overrides:
